meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Okay, okay, I'll get started on the review already! So, you want me to dive into the world of Braid: Anniversary Edition, huh? Well, buckle up, folks, because this game is a wild ride... of cleverness, puzzles, and nostalgia!

As I dived back into the world of Braid, I couldn't help but think about how far we've come in gaming since its initial release. And, honestly, it's amazing to see that this classic indie game still holds up today. The visuals have been given a nice facelift, making it look like a brand new game ( minus the creepy, unsettling vibe, of course).

Now, let's get to what really matters – the gameplay! As some critics might say (cough, God is a Geek, cough), Braid Anniversary Edition is still "tough yet rewarding" in its puzzles. And I agree! The way you weave through time to solve these brain-twisters is pure magic.

But, don't just take my word for it! What about the other critics? Well, it seems like some of them are singing the same tune (see what I did there?). Push Square says it's a "classic that revolutionized the indie game landscape" and that this Anniversary Edition is worth a playthrough. Meanwhile, PlayStation Universe praises its clever design and ingenious puzzles.

Now, don't get me wrong – not everyone loves Braid. Some folks might find it too linear or its puzzles too frustrating (hello, Metro GameCentral!). But hey, that's the beauty of indie games, right? They can be polarizing!

What about the Anniversary Edition specifically? Well, as some critics pointed out (cough, PlayStation LifeStyle, cough), it's not like there are a ton of new features. And that might be true... but does that matter when the core game is still so amazing? I think not! The additional levels and visuals make it worth playing again (or for the first time, if you're new to this party).

In conclusion, Braid: Anniversary Edition is a must-play for any self-respecting gamer. Sure, some folks might find it too challenging or linear, but that's part of its charm. And hey, at least we can all agree on one thing – Jonathan Blow's game has aged like fine wine (see what I did there again?).

So, if you haven't played Braid yet... what are you even doing with your life?! Get on it, and let me know what you think!

And to my fellow critics out there...

God is a Geek: "tough yet rewarding" indeed!
Metro GameCentral: yeah, the original flaws still exist...
Push Square: we love it when games revolutionize!
PlayStation Universe: clever design + ingenious puzzles = pure magic!
Video Chums: throwback to simpler times? Check!
Digital Chumps: essential product for fans of indie devs!

Now, that's what I call a review! See you in the next one, Hippo Penny-style!
